name: Automate Business Partner Outreach with Google Maps, GPT-4 & WhatsApp
description:
Automate Outreach Prospect automates finding, enriching, and messaging potential partners (like restaurants, malls, and bars) using Apify Google Maps scraping, Perplexity enrichment, OpenAI LLMs, Google Sheets, Pinecone knowledge, and WhatsApp sending via GOWA. It turns a manual, slow outreach funnel into a repeatable pipeline so your team spends time closing deals instead of copy-pasting contact details.

![Frame 22.png](fileId:2178)

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Disclaimer

This workflow uses community nodes for WhatsApp functionality:
- [GOWA](https://github.com/aldinokemal/go-whatsapp-web-multidevice)
- [WhatsApp HTTP API](https://waha.devlike.pro)

## üí° Why Use Automate Outreach Prospect?

- **Faster prospecting:** Scrape up to 150 leads per search (jumlah leads = 150) and queue them for outreach in minutes, cutting manual research time from days to hours.
- **Fixes the busywork:** Automatically enrich missing contact data and only send messages to records with phone numbers, so you stop chasing dead leads.
- **Measurable lift:** Enrich in batches (enrichment batch size = 20), improving outbound readiness and increasing contactable leads per campaign by dozens each run.
- **Better conversions with context:** Use a searchable company knowledge base (Pinecone + LlamaIndex) so replies are handled with context ‚Äî less robotic, more relevant. Yes, your bot can sound like a helpful human (minus the coffee breath).

## ‚ö° Perfect For

- **Sales Ops:** Teams that need to scale partner outreach without hiring a mini-empire of SDRs.
- **Growth Marketers:** People who want repeatable local outreach campaigns (mall, restaurant, bar categories).
- **Small Biz Owners:** Quick way to build partnership lists and automate first outreach without becoming a spreadsheet hermit.

## üîß How It Works

### ‚è± Trigger
Manual scrape start or scheduled jobs: Daily Outbound Schedule, Schedule Outbound message, or Knowledge Base Updated Trigger.

### üìé Process
Apify Google Maps Scraper gathers business listings (location, phone, socials). Results are fetched and saved to Google Sheets (Raw Data). Unenriched records are split and enriched via Perplexity, then saved back.

### ü§ñ Smart Logic
OpenAI LLM creates personalized initial messages, and a Reply Handler AI Agent, uses Pinecone/knowledge embeddings to interpret replies and decide next actions (save PICs, request meeting, send proposal).

### üíå Output
Outbound messages are sent over WhatsApp using GOWA nodes (typing indicators, simulated typing delays, read receipts) and replies are handled & stored; qualified PIC contacts are appended to a Leads sheet.

### üóÇ Storage
Google Sheets is the central datastore (Raw Data, Leads Collected). Knowledge base lives in Google Drive and Pinecone (n8n-recharge, namespace CompanyKnowledgeBased). Conversation memory stored in Postgres/Neon.

## üîê Quick Setup

1. **Import Workflow:** Import JSON file to your [n8n instances](https://n8n.partnerlinks.io/khmuhtadin)

2. **Add Credentials:**
   - Google Sheets OAuth2
   - Google Drive OAuth2
   - Apify API token
   - OpenAI API
   - Perplexity API
   - Pinecone API
   - Cohere API
   - LlamaIndex Cloud key
   - GOWA (WhatsApp) credentials
   - WAHA webhook (optional)
   - PostgreSQL/Neon

3. **Customize Parameters:**
   - Scraping parameters (Location Category, lokasi, jumlah leads, minimum Stars, Skip Closed Place)
   - Message templates/time greetings
   - Enrichment batch size

4. **Update Configuration:**
   - Google Drive doc ID
   - Google Sheets ID
   - Apify actor config
   - Pinecone index name
   - Pinecone namespaces
   - LlamaIndex endpoints (if used)

5. **Test Setup:**
   Run a manual scrape with a real location and send a single outbound message to verify WhatsApp delivery and reply handling.

## üß© Required Services

- Active [n8n instances](https://n8n.partnerlinks.io/khmuhtadin)
- Google Sheets & Google Drive accounts (OAuth2)
- Apify account & actor access (Google Maps Scraper)
- OpenAI API key (for LLMs & embeddings)
- Perplexity API key (enrichment)
- Pinecone account (vector index n8n-recharge)
- Cohere API (reranker, optional)
- LlamaIndex Cloud (optional document parsing)
- GOWA / WA WhatsApp setup (or WAHA alternative)
- PostgreSQL/Neon for conversation memory


## üß† Workflow Nodes

### Triggers & Scheduling
- Incoming message
- Manual Trigger - Start Scraping
- Daily Outbound Schedule
- Schedule Outbound message
- Knowledge Base Updated Trigger

### Data Collection & Processing
- Configure Scraping Parameters
- Execute Google Maps Scraper
- Fetch Scraped Business Data
- Save Raw Business Leads
- Get Unenriched Records
- Limit Enrichment Batch Size
- Split Records for Processing

### Data Enrichment
- Business Data Enrichment
- Parse Enrichment Response
- Save Enriched Business Data

### Outbound Messaging
- Get Outbound Candidates
- Limit Outbound Batch Size
- Validate Phone Number Exists
- Prepare Outbound Session Data
- Outbound Message Generator
- Outbound Message LLM
- Format Outbound Message Data

### WhatsApp Communication
- Show Typing Indicator - Outbound
- Simulate Typing Delay - Outbound
- Send Outbound WhatsApp Message
- Mark as Contacted
- Extract WhatsApp Session Data

### Reply Handling
- Reply Handler AI Agent
- Reply Handler LLM
- Format Reply Message Data
- Show Typing Indicator - Reply
- Simulate Typing Delay - Reply
- Send WhatsApp Reply
- Save Lead Contact Information

### Knowledge Management
- Store Knowledge Embeddings
- Query Knowledge Base
- Reply Conversation Memory
- Outbound Conversation Memory

Made by: **[Khaisa Studio](https://khaisa.studio?utm_source=n8nofficial)**  
**Need custom work?** [Contact Me](https://khmuhtadin.com/contact)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

parameters.customBody:
={
    "includeWebResults": false,
    "language": "en",
    "leadsEnrichmentDepartments": [
        "marketing"
    ],
    "locationQuery": "{{ $json.lokasi }}",
    "maxCrawledPlacesPerSearch": {{ $json['jumlah leads'] }},
    "maxImages": 0,
    "maximumLeadsEnrichmentRecords": 0,
    "placeMinimumStars": "{{ $json['minimum Stars'] }}",
    "scrapeContacts": true,
    "scrapeDirectories": false,
    "scrapeImageAuthors": false,
    "scrapePlaceDetailPage": false,
    "scrapeReviewsPersonalData": true,
    "scrapeTableReservationProvider": false,
    "searchStringsArray": [
        {{ $json['Location Category'] }}
    ],
    "skipClosedPlaces": {{ $json['Skip Closed Place'] }}
}

options.systemMessage:
=[Yourcompany] Sales Assistant - Siska (Reply Handler)
You are "Siska" from [Yourcompany], handling replies from potential partners after opening messages have been sent.
Conversation Flow Analysis
Analyze replies and follow the appropriate flow:
1. Partner Directly Provides PIC Contact
Detection: Reply contains name, position, phone number, or contact email
Response: "Thank you for the information! Our sales team will directly contact [PIC name] to discuss further cooperation."
Action: Save contact to database using append tool
2. Partner Asks About Partnership Format
Detection: Questions like "what kind of partnership?", "how does the cooperation work?", "what's being offered?"
Response: Explain casually using knowledge base:
"Oh, so here's how it works... we provide vending machines for powerbank rental at your location. So customers who need to charge their phones can directly rent powerbanks from our machine.
By the way, are you the one handling partnerships here? Or is there a specific PIC who usually manages partnerships like this?"
3. Partner Requests Proposal
Detection: Requests like "send proposal first", "can you email the proposal?", "do you have a company profile?"
Response: "Alright, we'll send the proposal shortly. Thank you for your interest in partnering with ReCharge!"
Action: Note proposal request
4. Partner Agrees to Meeting/Call
Detection: Positive responses like "yes, that's fine", "it can be explained", "please call"
Response: "Great! We can meet in person to explain in more detail. When would be a good time for you?"
Action: Note willingness for offline meeting
5. Identifying the Right PIC

If speaking with the right PIC: Offer offline meeting
If not the right PIC: "I see, so who would be the PIC who usually handles partnerships or cooperation here? So I can coordinate directly with the person in charge."

6. Partner Not Interested/Declining
Detection: Rejections like "not interested", "don't need it", "not currently needed"
Response: "Thank you for your time. If you ever need partnership opportunities in the future, don't hesitate to contact us!"
Tools Usage:

Pinecone: Use to explain ReCharge cooperation details
Google Sheets: Use ONLY when receiving PIC contact or partnership info. Data format:

Place: Company/location name (from previous conversation context)
name: PIC name
title: PIC position
phone_number: PIC phone number



Data Context:

ALWAYS remember company/location name from previous messages in conversation history
If not available in history, ask "Sorry, is this for partnership with which company/location?"

Response Guidelines:

Always use polite and professional Indonesian language
Use line breaks for better readability
Match the partner's energy level
Focus on clear next steps

Important Notes:

Don't over-explain if partner has already provided contact
Always confirm the next action to be taken
Maintain friendly but professional tone

parameters.text:
=company name: {{ $('Get Outbound Candidates').item.json.Title }}

Address: {{ $('Get Outbound Candidates').item.json.Address }}

options.systemMessage:
=# ReCharge Outbound Message Initiator - Jessica

You are "Jessica", a sales representative from [Yourcompany]. Your task is to generate the initial outbound message for cold outreach to potential partners.

## Your Role:
Generate a personalized greeting message in Indonesian for starting conversations with potential business partners.

## Message Template:
Always use this exact format:
"Halo Selamat [waktu], 

Perkenalkan saya Siska dari [Yourcompany]. Salam kenal. 

Saya ingin bertanya kalau saya ingin bekerjasama dengan [nama lokasi/brand] saya bisa kontak kebagian apa?"

## Instructions:
- Replace [waktu] with appropriate time greeting:
  * Pagi (06:00-11:59)
  * Siang (12:00-17:59) 
  * Sore (18:00-23:59)
- Replace [nama lokasi/brand] with the business name from the input data
- This is ONLY for the initial outbound message
- Keep the message professional and friendly
- Do not engage in conversation - just deliver the opening message

## Important Notes:
- This session will be stored using the phone number as session key
- Reply handling will be managed by a separate workflow
- Do not access knowledge base for this simple greeting
- Focus only on generating the opening message

message.content:
=You are a web-grounded data enricher for Indonesian business listings. Your job is to search the live web, cross-verify facts, and fill missing fields with high precision and source citations. Follow these rules strictly:

Scope & Matching

Target entity is a physical place (Google Maps Place). Match using: name, full address, city/state, category, and any official brand owner. Prefer sources that show the exact address or a clear ‚Äúofficial‚Äù site/social of the venue.

If there‚Äôs any doubt (similar mall names/brands), treat as ambiguous and return null with a note; do not guess.

Research Requirements

Use multiple reputable sources (official site, official social profiles, Google Business/Maps, authoritative news or operator/brand pages).

Prefer the official website of the venue/brand/operator over directories. If no website exists but an official Instagram or Facebook page exists, you may use that as website only if it‚Äôs clearly the official presence of the venue.

Extract public contact email and phone (published for customers). Don‚Äôt invent generic addresses (e.g., info@...) unless it is explicitly listed.

Normalization

website: canonical HTTPS URL, strip tracking params, no URL shorteners, no generic domains like just instagram.com‚Äîuse the page URL (e.g., https://www.instagram.com/livingworlddenpasar/).

phone_number: E.164 with Indonesia code, e.g., +62361xxxxxxx or +628xx... for mobiles. Remove spaces/dashes.

email: lowercase, single address (prefer the most official/general contact).

instagram, facebook, linkedin: full canonical profile/page URLs (no querystrings).

Keep all other provided fields as-is unless obviously misspelled (don‚Äôt ‚Äúfix‚Äù names).

Output Contract (strict)
Return only JSON, no prose. Use this exact shape:

{
  "row_number": <number>,
  "place_id": "<string>",
  "title": "<string>",
  "category": "<string>",
  "city": "<string>",
  "state": "<string>",
  "address": "<string>",
  "company_name": "<string|null>",
  "website": "<string|null>",
  "email": "<string|null>",
  "phone_number": "<string|null>",
  "instagram": "<string|null>",
  "facebook": "<string|null>",
  "linkedin": "<string|null>",
  "review_count": <number|null>,
  "average_stars": <number|null>,
  "enriched": "yes",
  "sources": {
    "company_name": ["<url>", "..."],
    "website": ["<url>", "..."],
    "email": ["<url>", "..."],
    "phone_number": ["<url>", "..."],
    "instagram": ["<url>", "..."],
    "facebook": ["<url>", "..."],
    "linkedin": ["<url>", "..."]
  },
  "confidence": {
    "company_name": 0.0,
    "website": 0.0,
    "email": 0.0,
    "phone_number": 0.0,
    "instagram": 0.0,
    "facebook": 0.0,
    "linkedin": 0.0
  },
  "notes": "<short explanation of any ambiguities or choices; empty string if none>"
}


Scoring & Nulls

Each confidence is 0.0‚Äì1.0. Use ‚â§0.6 if inferred from indirect/secondary sources; ‚â•0.8 if confirmed on the official site or multiple agreeing sources.

If not found or ambiguous, set the field to null, provide a short reason in notes, and still include the most relevant sources you checked.

Formatting

Output must be valid JSON and only that JSON. No markdown code fences in the final answer to the user.

=Enrich the following venue record. Research the live web (both Indonesian and English sources), fill any missing fields, normalize as specified, cite sources, and return only the JSON object defined in the schema. If any field can‚Äôt be verified confidently, return null and explain briefly in notes.

{
  "row_number": {{ $json.row_number }},
  "place_id": {{ JSON.stringify($json['Place Id'] ?? null) }},
  "title": {{ JSON.stringify($json.Title ?? null) }},
  "category": {{ JSON.stringify($json.Category ?? null) }},
  "city": {{ JSON.stringify($json.City ?? null) }},
  "state": {{ JSON.stringify($json.State ?? null) }},
  "address": {{ JSON.stringify($json.Address ?? null) }},
  "company_name": null,
  "website": {{ JSON.stringify($json.Website ?? null) }},
  "email": {{ JSON.stringify($json.Email ?? null) }},
  "phone_number": {{ JSON.stringify($json['Phone Number'] ?? null) }},
  "instagram": {{ JSON.stringify($json.Instagram ?? null) }},
  "facebook": {{ JSON.stringify($json.Facebook ?? null) }},
  "linkedin": {{ JSON.stringify($json.Linkedin ?? null) }},
  "review_count": {{ $json['Review Count'] }},
  "average_stars": {{ $json['Average Stars'] }}
}

Important:
Replace placeholder/invalid values (like "instagram.com", "not found") with either a normalized value or null.
Keep row_number, place_id, title, category, city, state, address, review_count, and average_stars unless you find a definitive correction on an official source‚Äîif corrected, explain in notes.
Return only JSON, no markdown.

parameters.toolDescription: you can get information about recharge from this vector store

parameters.fieldToSplitOut: =Place Id, Title, Category, City, State, Address, Company name, Website, Email, Phone Number, Instagram, Facebook, Linkedin, Review Count, Average Stars, enriched

parameters.toolDescription:
=IMPORTANT: Use this tool ONLY to store PIC contact given by partner or save proposal inquiry. 

Field to save: 
- Place (location or brand)
- Name (PIC Name)
- Title (PIC Title)
- Phone Number (PIC Phone Number or whatsapp)

Makesure all fields are available. Don't put "unknown", "empty", or similar things, if not full fields available, ask for the informations

parameters.content:
# Required Credentials

## üîë API Keys & Services

**Google Services**
- Google Sheets OAuth2 - [Setup Guide](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/credentials)
- Google Drive OAuth2 - [Setup Guide](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/credentials)

**AI & ML Services**
- OpenAI API - [Get API Key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)
- Pinecone Vector DB - [Get API Key](https://app.pinecone.io/)
- Cohere Reranker - [Get API Key](https://dashboard.cohere.ai/api-keys)
- LlamaIndex Cloud - [Get API Key](https://cloud.llamaindex.ai/)
- Perplexity API - [Get API Key](https://www.perplexity.ai/settings/api)

**Communication**
- GOWA - [GO Whatsap](https://github.com/aldinokemal/go-whatsapp-web-multidevice)
- WAHA - [Whatasapp HTTP API](https://waha.devlike.pro/)

**Data Collection**
- Apify Scraping Service - [Get API Token](https://console.apify.com/account/integrations)

**Database**
- PostgreSQL/Neon - [Create Database](https://console.neon.tech/)

## üìã Setup Checklist
- [ ] All credentials configured in n8n
- [ ] Google Sheets permissions granted
- [ ] WhatsApp webhook configured
- [ ] Pinecone index created: n8n-recharge
- [ ] PostgreSQL tables: rechargechathistories, RechargeChatHistories

# Database Schema & Setup Requirements

## **Google Sheets Structure**
- **Raw Data Sheet**: Business listings with contact info, social media, ratings
- **Leads Sheet**: Qualified prospects with PIC details

## **PostgreSQL Tables**
- **Chat History**: Conversation memory and session management
- **User Sessions**: WhatsApp number mapping and state tracking

## **Pinecone Configuration**
- **Vector Index**: Company knowledge base storage
- **Embeddings**: text-embedding-3-large (3072 dimensions)
- **Namespaces**: Separate knowledge domains

## **File Storage**
- **Knowledge Base**: Google Drive document auto-sync
- **Templates**: Message templates and scripts
